conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C. Predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Point A has yellow liquid, point B has blue liquid, and point C has green liquid.
Container D is on the left side at the bottom, and container E is on the right side at the bottom.
A grey slanted barrier is positioned below point A.
A blue baffle is positioned below point B.
A black baffle is positioned below point C.
An orange slanted barrier is positioned below the black baffle.
A purple slanted barrier is positioned below the orange barrier.

premise: Stream A hits the grey slanted barrier and changes its flow direction to the right.
conclusion: The yellow liquid from point A flows to the right after hitting the grey slanted barrier.

premise: Stream B strikes the blue baffle and turns right.
conclusion: The blue liquid from point B flows to the right after hitting the blue baffle.

premise: Stream C encounters the black baffle and collides with stream B.
conclusion: The green liquid from point C mixes with the blue liquid from point B after hitting the black baffle.

premise: The mixture of liquid from B and C flows to the left together.
conclusion: The mixed liquid from points B and C flows to the left after mixing.

premise: The liquid from A changes its flow direction to the right after passing through the brown barrier.
conclusion: The yellow liquid from point A flows to the right after passing through the brown barrier.

premise: The liquid from BC mixes and flows following the paths shaped by the angled barriers.
conclusion: The mixed liquid from points B and C flows along the paths shaped by the angled barriers.

premise: The liquid from BC finally merges with the liquid from A.
conclusion: The mixed liquid from points B and C merges with the yellow liquid from point A.
